data.name: CANT_FIND_BACKUP_FILE
data.value:
There is a backup data for {0}.
However, this file has either been moved or deleted.
If you've moved this file, go to Tools > Game Backup Files and set the new local file path. If this file was deleted, remove the backup file data and backup the file again.
This file cannot be uninstalled to avoid missing game files, so it will be ignored.

data.name: HELP_TRANSLATE
data.value: Help translate Arisen Studio on Crowdin

data.name: HOW_TO_ACTIVATE_DEMO
data.value:
Activating a C00/Demo package is very easy and doesn't require a rap file. It can be done using ReActPSN or PSNPatch.
ReActPSN : Run the homebrew while pressing and holding circle on your controller. PSNPatch : Run PSNPatch and press R1. It should displays a list of the games that have been unlocked.

data.name: HOW_TO_ACTIVATE_DEMO_QUESTION
data.value: How do I activate a C00/Demo that has a free license?

data.name: HOW_TO_ACTIVATE_RAP
data.value:
Activating a package using a rap file requires few steps. It can be done with ReActPSN or PSNPatch. However, I will only describe how to do it with ReActPSN.
1. Format a USB key in FAT32. 2. Create the folder 'exdata' at the root of the USB key. 3. Move the corresponding RAP file for the games you want to activate in the exdata folder. Warning: Do not rename rap files ! You need to leave their original ugly name. 4. Connect the USB key in the right USB port of the PS3 (the closest to the bluray drive). 5. Delete the ReActPSN user on your PS3 if it exists. 6. Create the account 'aa' (without quotes) and open the account. 7. Run ReActPSN and the screen should go black, then you should hear beeps and then the PS3 should reboot. 8. The user 'aa' should be gone now and the account 'ReActPSN' automatically created. 9. You're done!

data.name: HOW_TO_ACTIVATE_RAP_QUESTION
data.value: How do I activate a PSN package with a RAP file?

data.name: NOTICE_INSTALL_REBUG_FILES
data.value:
These files are being installed to the firmware folder (dev_rebug) which is for REBUG Custom Firmware only. Please read everything below before proceeding.
- It's recommended to first create a backup of the entire folder before installing any files. - Your console must be running Rebug custom firmware. - REBUG TOOLBOX must be open during installation - Any missing or corrupt files in this folder can impact your console performance. - If you have issues after rebooting console, enter recovery mode and reinstall the custom firmware.
Only continue at your own risk and only if you know what you're doing.
Do you want to continue?

data.name: NO_BACKUP_FILE_FOUND
data.value: You don't have a backup for the: {0} file. This file will be ignored to prevent issues with missing game files. You must install the game update to restore the original file.

data.name: REDIRECT_TO_GITHUB_ISSUES

You will now be redirected to our GitHub Issues page and all details will be automatically filled for you. Please provide information about the issue to help us fix your problem.
Click the 'Submit' button to open a new issue which can help us fix any problems.

data.name: REFER_TO_BASE_DIRECTORY

data.name: REQUIRES_PREVIOUS_USB_DEVICE
data.value:
Files have been installed to a USB device connected to your console. You can either uninstall them now or manually delete them.
If you would like to uninstall the files now, connect the same USB device you installed the mods to into the same port of your console and click 'Yes' to continue. If you don't want to uninstall the files, click 'No' and all of these files will be ignored.
